bibl.title: Albert Briggs v. Territory of Washington. Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District Court of Jefferson County

body.p: Territory of Washington 3rd Jud. District, County of Port Townsend Jefferson
To E.D. Smith, acting Constable Port Townsend Precinct

Whereas, it has been alleged on oath before the Hon. C.C. Hewitt, District Judge, on petition for writ of "Habeas Corpus", That you have in your custody the person of Albert Briggs, under process in the matter a commitment to answer for some alleged offense at the next term of the Dist. Court, and also under process in the matter of a warrant to keep the peace, issued by the William Chalmers
and whereas, it has been alleged that said custody and restraint are illegal
Now, therefor in the name of the United States, You are hereby commanded to produce the person of Albert Briggs before the said
District Judge, at the Court House in Port Townsend forthwwith
To the said inquiring be made in the cause and legality of said restraint
and that you then and there release return to this writ in the manner required by law
Witness the Hon. C.C. Hewitt Judge of the U.S. Dist. County 3rd Jud. District W.T. This 14th day of January 1865
